name: Orchid Key Inn

reviews.title: High Expectations!
reviews.text: Based on the reviews from others, I thought Orchid Key Inn would be the perfect spot to reserve for a future vacation. It seems the universal theme is the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Just had two conversations with Trudy making my reservation. I now understand what other reviewers have experienced without even stepping foot on the property. Thank you Trudy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Orchid Key Inn in Key West for a week in the middle of August. Although the weather was hot, it was beautiful. The best parts of our days were spent hanging out at the pool area and happy hour at the hotel bar at night time. The staff was amazing. They were super friendly and had great insight to the best places to for us to go and the best things to do. The bartender, Amy, was more than welcoming. She made us feel like we were in her house having cocktails. She offered great service, friendly conversation, and local insight. Brennan was part of the front desk staff and he was also exceptional. They made our stay and would be the reason we would go back.
reviews.title: Awesome time in Key West!

reviews.text: The hotel is located on Duval Street and far enough away from the chaos yet the chaos was still in walking distance, chaos meaning fun party spots. We found the best restaurants to be closest to the hotel as well. The rooms were unbelievably clean and very modern in style. I would definitely reccommend this hotel to anyone who was traveling to Key West, except for kids. Not a spot for kids, however, I do not think Key West in general is a place for kids. Too much adult fun to be had.
reviews.title: Amazing stay in the heart of, but just far enough away from all the action in Key West.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn is located on Duval street just far enough down from all the chaos and insanity that takes place on a nightly basis. My wife and I rented bikes one day and were able to get in most of the tourist attractions and get in quality beach time due to the locale of the inn. Pool, bar and ambiance were all exceptional and we really enjoyed the pleasant staff. The rooms were clean, modern and very comfortable. The breakfast and happy hour were the icing on the cake. Def recommend to anyone headed to Key West.
reviews.title: Hip motel in a great location

reviews.text: The Orchid Key Inn is a very charming motel and is in a convenient location, close enough to walk to the more lively part of Duval, but in a quieter area. The rooms were remodeled a few years ago, they are small, but well designed and efficient. Everything was immaculately cleaned. We enjoyed the breakfast each morning, they had a lot of fresh fruit, pastries, yogurts, juices, etc to choose from. And the common areas are really lovely, lots of beautiful landscaping and orchis growing in most of the trees. We would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Cool motel-style property in the heart of Old Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From it's 1950's/Art Deco look, this is a lovely little place to stay in Key West. You are just 2 blocks from Hemmingway's house, but removed from all the craziness & noise that is on the other end of Duval. You have a nice pool area & spa, with the rooms surrounding it. The room was spacious, with king bed, coffee bar area & large bathroom & shower. A great little bar area & happy hour is not to be missed. The staff is so friendly and helpful with tips and suggestions
reviews.title: A little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel as an escape with my fiancee and intentionally did not want to be right in the middle of the partying on Duval Street; but was pleased to see that while it was much quieter at the Orchid Key, it was still very close to the party district for when we wanted to go there - but we could also relax poolside with quiet music and cocktails if we chose to do that. The service from the front desk to the maid services to the bartender at the small quaint bar at the hotel was outstanding. The rooms are charming, clean and comfortable. The hotel is small enough that it has the feel a B&B in that you can easily make friends with other customers or just as easily keep to yourself. I would absolutely stay here every time I visit Key West in the future. It is hands down my favorite hotel in the area.
reviews.title: Charming Oasis a convenient to everything

reviews.text: Can't say enough positive things about this hotel. The website photos are true likenesses. What you see is actually what you get. Kim and Brandon at the front desk were a wealth of information regarding what to do and where to go as well as providing us with discount coupons. Rooms were clean, clean, clean, and nicely decorated. The A/C was so quiet I wasn't sure it was running. The pool was a great respite from the heat of mid day which lead into an awesome happy hour. Such a great time at happy hour, we missed dinner two nights in a row! Absolutely a great location as well. The free breakfast was amazing and much appreciated. I can't imagine any negative comments regarding the Orchid Key Inn. If you run into any, just disregard them. You won't be disappointed at the Orchid Key Inn! I definitely will go back.
reviews.title: A gem of a hotel!

reviews.text: I must say, myself along with some friends are "martini/cosmo afficianados. On an Annual trip to NYC we have our favorite bar (s) and always try martinis/cosmos....regardless of the co$t. Even at the Plaza, R Lounge, and clubs. Obviously, some of the views are outstanding (along with the drinks but....
reviews.title: Best bartender/Cocktails anywhere...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ...Without a doubt the BEST COSMO I HAVE EVER HAVE (AND PROBABLY WILL) is the "orchid key cosmo". Shaken perfectly, and to top it off their own infused Vodka which is carefully and perfectly created by the bartender named Mike.
reviews.title: Great Stay in the Keys

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stumbled on the Orchid Key Inn entirely by accident and managed to book the last available room on the Thursday before Labor Day and were both impressed by the attitude and friendliness of the staff, as well as the standard of the decor.
reviews.title: One night was not enough!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast by the pool provided a wonderful start to the day after a good night's rest in our cosy room. We would happily have stayed longer, despite that it was the second most expensive place stayed in (beaten only by the Marriott in Key Largo) but we wanted to see as much of Florida as possible, so headed off for the West coast the next day.
reviews.title: Chill out in Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to 'chill' in Key West here's the place to stay.
reviews.title: what a great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 3 days recently and the level of service, rooms and particularly the complimentary breakfast was awesome! The rooms are a little small, but this adds to the character and wasn't an issue for us.
reviews.title: Wedding anniversary retriet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area was the perfect place to relax and overall this is a winning destination. Location is good, just off Duval; far enough away from the bars for a quiet stay. You are charged $8 for daily parking, which is reasonable if you compare to Miami ($25-$35 / day).
reviews.title: Great place can't wait to return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights last week. What can I say? The hotel has everything. The rooms are beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. A very good breakfast served by very attentive staff who are very concerned to make sure you have had enough. A great pool and everyone is given 'VIP' vouchers for a free drink at the bar. Along with cheese and nibbles, what a great way to start your stay with them. The staff are so helpful, with recommendations for restaurants and excursions. I cannot recommend highly enough. And the gardens are lovely, orchids and palm trees and water features everywhere. And did I mention the super showers in the bathroom. Do yourself a favour and stay here.
reviews.title: This hotel has it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had such a pleasant experience last year that we made sure to return to the Orchid Key Inn again a year later. As others have noted, the staff is first-rate - from Kim, Brandon and Cindy at the front desk to Amy and especially Mike at the bar. Mike is THE best mixologist on the island and is constantly working on new and different drinks that delight us every time. The rooms are always crisp and clean and the vibe of the Inn is always upbeat and friendly. The pool area is an attractive place to have breakfast, or later in the day, to lounge around and read. We are Kansas City foodies, so the restaurant recommendations were important to us and generally right-on. Others have noted the diversity of those visiting the Orchid Key Inn, and we observed the same. Met some very interesting people! We will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Return visit as good as the first
Nice hotel
reviews.text: Nice hotel, rooms good standard. Very nice breakfast just what you need to start the day all nice, fresh, healthy and plentiful. Nice pool and happy hour a nice touch. Lovely staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only thing I was caught out on was complimentary water and coffee the first day is free but does not get topped up daily. We got caught out coming back from a boat trip and was expecting a replen of bottled water so just remember to get your own water if staying more than 1 day.
reviews.title: Old Florida All Dressed Up

reviews.text: Take an old Florida motor lodge, put it in the hands of extremely capable owners and an award winning staff, add a touch of the eclectic, and you have found the Orchid Key. In the few days we stayed there, we meet visitors from the UK, all over Europe, a few from Asia. Poolside breakfast starts the day on a positive note, and late afternoon cocktails with a dip in the pool or a soak in the hot tub, is the way to get ready for a night on the town. Landscaping was beautiful and well maintained. We will be back.............this is a very impressive hotel.
reviews.title: Loved our visit

description: Orchid Key Inn ranked in top 10 “Best Small Hotels in the United States”— Miami Herald.... The luxury Orchid Key is located on Duval Street and Truman; the very crossroads of Historic Old Town. Lush tropical landscapes surround our elegant amenity filled guest rooms and suites which surround our tranquil waterfalls, peaceful sun deck, heated pool, and spa. Everything the island is famous for is just foot steps outside our gates. Come experience the five orchid treatment.
